description: Multiple choice quizzes (Parts 1a & 1b) and written assignment (Part 2) covering lecture content. Includes stress/strain analysis, failure prediction, and material behavior concepts.
2-hour online open-book test assessing content from first half of term. Includes numerical problems and short answers on stress transformations, failure criteria, and mechanical analysis.

Four individual reports on mechanical testing labs: tensile testing (metals), hardness testing, strain rate effects (polymers), and Charpy impact testing. Requires data analysis and property determination.
2hr 10min exam during university examination period. Assesses second half content including deformation mechanisms, creep, fatigue, and temperature/strain rate effects on materials.
